result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott L Reisinger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Kees advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant
Motion to forfeit bail granted.
Ext Code 3

Attorney Anna M Kees in court.   Defendant Scott L Reisinger did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 9:04 am.  Court notes the non compliance with WCS.   Court issues a capias, cash bail in the amount of $5000.00.  Cash bail is revoked/forfeited.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Plea hearing on July 6, 2017 at 09:00 am.

DEFENDANT TO COMPLY WITH WCS SUPERVISION. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Scott L Reisinger in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Atty. Kees requests bond be modified to require WCS as the defendant would like to apply for Drug Treatment Court. Court will modify the bond to require WCS supervision.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 6, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on May 3, 2017 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Scott L Reisinger
Current: 13465 W Grange, New Berlin, WI 53151 United States  (Effective: 04-13-2017)
Prior: 2108 S. 85th St, West Allis, WI 53227 United States
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Scott L Reisinger in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of Information.  Due to the age of the case, the State requests an arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for May 3, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 13, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Scott L Reisinger in court with attorney Anna M Kees.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection rec'd from defense counsel.
Hearing on February 21, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Scott L Reisinger in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant stated the PD in Court was going to talk to defendant's old attorney. Defendant would need to reapply at the Public Defender's Office.Defendant requests a 90 day adjournment to obtain counsel.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 21, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Scott L Reisinger

Prior: 13465 W Grange Ave, New Berlin, WI 53151
Hearing on February 13, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Scott L Reisinger in court, in custody, with attorney David Herring for  Kelsey Loshaw.   Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not been evaluated by the Public Defender.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 13, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
BOND SET AT $500.00
